intro: Conopodium trichophyllum, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbages. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Conopodium trichophyllum typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and roadsides.
